body_content.explanation: affected by bipolar disorder (= a mental health condition in which a person can at times be very depressed and at other times very excited and energetic):
examples: I now realize I have been bipolar since my teens.
She has three children, including an older bipolar daughter.

body_content.explanation: of a cell, having only one structure projecting (= sticking out) from it:
in which two countries or areas have most of the power:
examples: It quickly became apparent that they did not fit into the bipolar world that both the Soviets and the United States thought they'd created.

body_content.explanation: relating to or having two poles (= ends of a magnet where the force is strongest, one that attracts and one that pushes away iron and steel):
consisting of two parts, choices, etc., especially when these are opposites:
examples: We could move away from a straightforward bipolar system, in which each side has only one of two options.

body_content.explanation: short for bipolar disorder: a mental health condition in which a person can at times be very depressed and at other times very excited and energetic:
examples: My parents thought they could cure my sister's bipolar by taking her camping and getting her eating well.
